metadata.title: CVE-2016-2842 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The doapr_outch function in crypto/bio/b_print.c in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before1.0.1s and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2g does not verify that a certain memoryallocation succeeds, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds write or memory consumption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a long string, as demonstrated by a largeamount of ASN.1 data, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-0799.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu2
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu2').
